page.title: 07Kettlesing-What's in a Name
page.content: Local place names suggest a strong Norse influence, e.g., Kettlesing = meadow; Menwith = common wood; Felliscliffe = Felagh's bank; Birstwith = farmstead. The scattered settlement pattern suggests a Norse pattern, though some experts question this, suggesting evidence of earlier settlements of English and Danish origin. Cinder Hills, near Menwith Hill, as the name suggests, was probably the site of medieval iron-working using local deposits and charcoal from the surrounding Forest of Knaresborough. Hollins Farm in High Birstwith suggests the site of holly copses, used in the medieval times for winter fodder.
